data.text:
LinkedIn and 3rd parties use essential and non-essential cookies to provide, secure, analyze and improve our Services, and to show you relevant ads (including professional and job ads) on and off LinkedIn. Learn more in our Cookie Policy.

Select Accept to consent or Reject to decline non-essential cookies for this use. You can update your choices at any time in your settings.

Niels Henrik David Bohr (7 October 1885 – 18 November 1962) was a Danish physicist who significantly contributed to the development of atomic structure and quantum theory. He was born in Copenhagen in 1885, and his father was a professor of physiology at the University of Copenhagen. Bohr's most significant contribution to physics was his development of a model of the atom known as the Bohr model. In this model, the electrons in an atom are arranged in distinct energy levels, and the atom emits or absorbs energy when an electron moves from one energy level to another. Bohr was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1922 for his atomic structure and quantum theory work. He later became a professor at the University of Copenhagen and was crucial in developing the first nuclear reactor. Bohr was also an advocate for international cooperation in science and played a role in establishing CERN, the European Organization for Nuclear Research. #nielsbohr #october7 #physicist #atomicstructure #quantumtheory #bohrmodel #nobelprize #techexplorist
